summary: Pokémon Sword and Pokémon Shield Announced
title: Pokémon Sword and Pokémon Shield Announced
body:
Nintendo has officially announced Pokémon Sword and Pokémon Shield, the eighth generation of the series heading to Nintendo Switch in late 2019.

The new games will take place in the Galar region, a brand new region that appears to be based on the United Kingdom and features a range of landscapes including “idyllic countryside, contemporary cities, thick forests, and craggy, snow-covered mountains." 

As with all entries in the series, players can choose from three new starting Pokémon: Grookey (Grass), Scorbunny (Fire), and Sobble (Water). The narrative follows a similar layout as previous entries allowing players to choose the gender, skin colour, and outfit of their character and battle to earn gym badges to earn the title of Champion, likely referring to the Elite Four.

The new starting Pokémon were the only new Pokémon featured in the trailer following the release of Meltan in Pokémon Go and Pokémon Let’s Go. Based on the new trailer, the series also looks to be going back to random encounters for wild Pokémon instead of sticking with Let’s Go introduction of Pokémon inhabiting the overworld.

Opinion: The new generation of Pokémon has landed with a ripple rather than a splash. I really enjoyed the Let’s Go games so I’m eagerly awaiting a new game in the series. I just want to see more from Sword and Shield before I form a real opinion. I’m certainly hoping for these games to be the series “Breath of the Wild” rather than just another formulaic entry with a few new bland Pokemon.

Looking for more from me? Follow me on Twitter to keep up to date with my latest posts, video game related nonsense, or if you just want to say hey!

Hello all! Welcome to my trash blog!

My name is Tali or Talice

summary: Introducing the Sharp Scale Pokemon - Wyveon! Eevee evolves into Wyveon once it levels up with high friendship while holding a...
caption:
Introducing the Sharp Scale Pokemon - Wyveon!

Eevee evolves into Wyveon once it levels up with high friendship while holding a Dragon Scale!

My steel type eeveelution Guardeon got WAY more attention and support that I anticipated (Thank you guys! <3), and some of you suggested a Dragon type eeveelution as Guardeon’s counterpart, so here you go!

summary: New Trailers for Detective Pikachu, X-Men: Dark Phoenix, DC’s Shazam & Hellboy!
title: New Trailers for Detective Pikachu, X-Men: Dark Phoenix, DC’s Shazam & Hellboy!
body:
Last week we got a bunch of new trailers for upcoming films like the live-action Pokémon movie Detective Pikachu, Fox’s final X-Men in the current continuity, Dark Phoenix, and the reboot of Hellboy. As usual, here’s everything you need to watch in one location!

Detective Pikachu

Have you ever wanted to see Ryan Reynolds play himself in a movie? That’s what we got with Deadpool. And honestly, that’s exactly what we’re getting with Detective Pikachu, a live-action adaptation of the Pokémon franchise based on a Japanese game of the same name. Detective Pikachu is in theatres May 10!

X-Men: Dark Phoenix

The future of the X-Men franchise is up in the air right now, but we can expect that the series will be rebooted within the MCU in the coming years. For now, X-Men: Dark Phoenix is the next (and final) installment releasing through Fox and a direct sequel to 2016’s X-Men: Apocalypse. Spoilers: Someone major dies and the trailer makes it VERY clear who that person is. X-Men: Dark Phoenix is due out in theatres July 7!

Hellboy

The series that nobody asked to be rebooted is being rebooted. Hellboy is back! The latest entry stars Stranger Things David Harbour is the leading role and is said to draw its inspiration from the Darkness Calls, The Wild Hunt, and The Storm and the Fury storylines. Hellboy is due out in theatres April 12!

Shazam!

DC’s decision to move away from their shared world and focus on individual characters and stories is the best decision they can make right now. Shazam! is the biggest departure from previous films, starring Zachary Levi in a more light-hearted, comedy focussed superhero venture. Shazam! is in theatres April 5!

Opinion: A good week for new trailers! Detective Pikachu is a movie I was already excited for and this trailer did way more for me than the first one due to the larger focus on the Pokémon world. As for Dark Phoenix, I’ve got almost no excitement for this movie due to the Fox-Disney merger, but I’ll give them credit for piquing my interest enough to consider watching it.

Looking for more from me? Follow me on Twitter to keep up to date with my latest posts, video game related nonsense, or if you just want to say hey!

summary: POKEDEX #025 Its nature is to store up electricity. Pikachu has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. These appear to become...
caption:
POKEDEX #025

Its nature is to store up electricity. Pikachu has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while it sleeps. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.

When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

blog.name: crossflux
blog.title: Christian Video Gamer
blog.description: Hello everyone, I'm post Let's Plays of video games on YouTube. I also do Christian Devotional videos that relate Christian concepts to characters and topics from the video games that I play. In the future, I'll be expanding the types of content that I post (I'm looking to include Theories and Top 10 videos). I pray that everyone is having a blessed day!

summary: Galar Pokemon Starters Acrylic canvas paintings I did of the new starters as I really like their designs. Scorbunny is my...
caption:
Galar Pokemon Starters

Acrylic canvas paintings I did of the new starters as I really like their designs. Scorbunny is my favourite so far but I’ll wait till their final evolutions are out before deciding
